articles.author: Jeff Mason, Tim Reid, Andy Sullivan, David Morgan
articles.description: Supporters of Donald Trump who attacked the U.S. Capitol four years ago will start leaving prison on Tuesday, pardoned by the new president in a flurry of Inauguration Day executive orders showing intent to stamp radical change on the country.
articles.title: Pardoned prisoners from Jan. 6 attack to go free on Trump's first full day in office

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dawoud Abu Alkas, Ramadan Abed
articles.description: On foot or riding rickshaws, many Palestinians exhausted by war in Gaza began returning to the ruins of their homes on the third day of a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, shocked by complete destruction.
articles.title: Gazans' joy at ceasefire dims as they visit ruined homes and dig for the dead

articles.author: Patrick Wingrove, Jennifer Rigby, Emma Farge
articles.description: The United States will leave the World Health Organization, President Donald Trump said on Monday, saying the global health agency had mishandled the COVID-19 pandemic and other international health crises.
articles.title: Trump orders US exit from the World Health Organization

articles.author: Joe Cash, Xiuhao Chen
articles.description: Donald Trump unexpectedly held off tariffs on China on his first day back at the White House and did not single it out as a threat, raising the prospect of a rapprochement as both sides look to gain from each other rather than rain harm on an adversary.
articles.title: Trump raises prospects for a negotiated reset on US-China ties

articles.author: Orhan Qereman
articles.description: The Kurdish forces guarding Islamic State fighters at a jail in northern Syria say they are opposed to handing the facility to the new Islamist rulers in Damascus as they brace for attacks by the ultra hardline group and monitor its attempts to re-emerge.
articles.title: Exclusive: Syrian Kurdish forces oppose handing jihadist jails to Islamist rulers

articles.author: Alexandra Ulmer
articles.description: Shortly after Donald Trump was sworn in as U.S. president on Monday, Honduran migrant Denia Mendez's phone started buzzing with news that the app she had used to book her U.S. asylum appointment was down.
articles.title: For one Honduran single mom fleeing threats, Trump dashes American dream

articles.author: Max Schwarz, Yves Herman
articles.description: Greenpeace activists evaded the World Economic Forum's tight security checks on Tuesday, staging a brief climate change protest outside the main hall of the annual meeting in Davos.
articles.title: Greenpeace activists slip through Davos security to stage climate protest

articles.author: Dmitry Antonov, Guy Faulconbridge, Liz Lee
articles.description: Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping share a broad world view, which portrays the West as decadent and in decline as China challenges U.S. supremacy in many areas.
articles.title: Xi and Putin discuss relations with Trump, Ukraine and Taiwan

articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: Immigrant and civil rights groups have filed the first lawsuits challenging executive orders U.S. President Donald Trump signed on Monday after taking office, including one that seeks to roll back birthright citizenship in the U.S.
articles.title: Lawsuits challenge Trump's birthright citizenship, other orders

articles.author: Layli Foroudi
articles.description: A protest leader in Martinique went on trial on Tuesday accused of trespassing on state property during cost-of-living demonstrations in a case his supporters say is another heavy-handed attempt to stop dissent in France's overseas territories.
articles.title: Martinique begins trial of social protests' leader Petitot
